turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I'm finally ready to update my resume. I haven't touched it in like 5 years. Where do I even start? I feel so overwhelmed!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand it can be daunting! Let's start with the basics. First, gather all your work history, including job titles, company names, dates of employment, and a brief description of your responsibilities and accomplishments for each role. Do you have that information readily available?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yeah, I think so. I have a document with most of it. But how detailed should I be with the descriptions? I don't want it to be too long, but I also want to highlight everything I did.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Aim for concise but impactful bullet points. Focus on quantifiable achievements whenever possible. For example, instead of saying 'Managed social media accounts,' try 'Increased social media engagement by 30% in Q2 2023 through targeted campaigns.' Use action verbs to start each bullet point. Keep each description to about 3-5 bullet points. Should you include older jobs if they aren't relevant to the job I am applying for?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, that's a tricky one. Good question! I believe that you should not include jobs older than 10-15 years unless they have a strong relevance to the job you are applying for. You should also leave older positions off of your resume if you are running out of room.
